integer :: n, i
integer(8) :: cnt(0:4) = 0
character(len=20) :: str
read(*,*) n
do i = 1, n
   read(*, '(A)') str
   select case (str(1:1))
   case ('M')

   case ('A')
      cnt(1) = cnt(1) + 1

integer :: n, i
integer(8) :: cnt(0:4) = 0
character(len=20) :: str
read(*,*) n
do i = 1, n
   read(*, '(A)') str
   select case (str(1:1))
   case ('M')
      cnt(0) = cnt(0) + 1
   case ('A')
      cnt(1) = cnt(1) + 1
   case ('R')
      cnt(2) = cnt(2) + 1
   case ('C')
      cnt(3) = cnt(3) + 1
   case ('H')
      cnt(4) = cnt(4) + 1
   end select
end do

Now, let's check the data types. The cnt array needs to be 64-bit integers because the product could be large. In Fortran, integer(8) is 64 bits. Alternatively, use selected_int_kind(18) to get a kind that can hold up to 1e18, but integer(8) is common.

So the code outline:

program combined
   implicit none
   integer :: n, i
   integer(8) :: cnt(0:4) = 0_8
   character(len=20) :: str
   integer(8) :: res
   character(len=20) :: str_res
   character :: first_char, output_char

   read(*,*) n
   do i = 1, n
      read(*, '(A)') str
      select case (str(1:1))
      case ('M')
         cnt(0) = cnt(0) + 1
      case ('A')
         cnt(1) = cnt(1) + 1
      case ('R')
         cnt(2) = cnt(2) + 1
      case ('C')
         cnt(3) = cnt(3) + 1
      case ('H')
         cnt(4) = cnt(4) + 1
      end select
   end do

   res = cnt(0)*cnt(1)*cnt(2) + cnt(0)*cnt(1)*cnt(3) + cnt(0)*cnt(1)*cnt(4) + &
         cnt(0)*cnt(2)*cnt(3) + cnt(0)*cnt(2)*cnt(4) + cnt(0)*cnt(3)*cnt(4) + &
         cnt(1)*cnt(2)*cnt(3) + cnt(1)*cnt(2)*cnt(4) + cnt(1)*cnt(3)*cnt(4) + &
         cnt(2)*cnt(3)*cnt(4)

   write(str_res, '(I0)') res
   first_char = str_res(1:1)
   output_char = char(ichar(first_char) + 1)
   write(*, '(A)') output_char

end program combined

program combined
   implicit none
   integer :: n, i
   integer(8) :: cnt(0:4) = 0_8
   character(len=100) :: str
   integer(8) :: res
   character(len=20) :: str_res
   character :: first_char, output_char

   read(*,*) n
   do i = 1, n
      read(*,*) str
      select case (str(1:1))
      case ('M')
         cnt(0) = cnt(0) + 1
      case ('A')
         cnt(1) = cnt(1) + 1
      case ('R')
         cnt(2) = cnt(2) + 1
      case ('C')
         cnt(3) = cnt(3) + 1
      case ('H')
         cnt(4) = cnt(4) + 1
      end select
   end do

   res = cnt(0)*cnt(1)*cnt(2) + cnt(0)*cnt(1)*cnt(3) + cnt(0)*cnt(1)*cnt(4) + &
         cnt(0)*cnt(2)*cnt(3) + cnt(0)*cnt(2)*cnt(4) + cnt(0)*cnt(3)*cnt(4) + &
         cnt(1)*cnt(2)*cnt(3) + cnt(1)*cnt(2)*cnt(4) + cnt(1)*cnt(3)*cnt(4) + &
         cnt(2)*cnt(3)*cnt(4)

   write(str_res, '(I0)') res
   first_char = str_res(1:1)
   output_char = char(ichar(first_char) + 1)
   write(*, '(A)') output_char

end program combined
